measured_by: Difference between subjective survival probability and actuarial probability (ELSA Expectations module)
justification: "Our key measure of optimism… is defined as S − O , where S is the subjective survival probability for each individual… and O is the statistically-derived true expected value based upon population life tables."

measured_by: Subjective survival probability question – variable target age task
justification: "ELSA asks all individuals ‘What are the chances that you will live to be X or more?’… We call this measure of the ‘variable target age task’."

measured_by: Subjective survival probability question – static target age task (chance of living to 85)
justification: "In Waves 3 to 9, all respondents under the age of 70 are asked ‘What are the chances that you will live to be 85 or more?’… We call this measure of the ‘static target age task’."

"The Big Five personality traits… were assessed at Wave 5 using a version of the Midlife Development Inventory… The adjectives making up each trait were as follows: Extraversion: outgoing, friendly, active, talkative and lively."
"Agreeableness: warm, helpful, soft-hearted, sympathetic and caring (Cronbach's alpha = 0.80)."
"Conscientiousness was calculated from the adjectives organised, responsible, thorough, hardworking and careless."
"Neuroticism: moody, worrying, nervous and calm (Cronbach's alpha = 0.68)."
"Openness to experience: creative, imaginative, intelligent, curious, sophisticated and adventurous (Cronbach's alpha = 0.79)."

"ELSA assessed respondents’ memory using an immediate and delayed word recall task… Scores from the immediate and delayed word recall task were summed together to produce a single measure, which we refer to as ‘Word Recall’."
